nav.div: Elkhorn Area School District » Coronavirus Update Center

p.span: EASD staff continue to closely monitor the situation regarding coronavirus (COVID-19). Please know that our schools are taking the necessary steps to prepare and the health and safety of our students and staff is of the utmost priority.
As further communications are sent to families, we will post them to this webpage.

                        tabs: [{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_0","title":"April 16, 2020 - A Message from the District Administrator / Un mensaje del administrador del distrito","content":"Please click on the link below for a video update from the District Administrator.


    
English
    
Español 


View Mr. Tadlock's presentation here >>

COVID-19 Noticias para Familias >>","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_1","title":"April 8, 2020 - A Message from the District Administrator / Un mensaje del administrador del distrito","content":"Dear Elkhorn Area School District Families,



I wanted to send you a quick message with a couple of updates and reminders. I will be brief. 


    
Thank you for your patience and support, it means a lot to the staff. 
    
I have no further determination on a return date. The current shutdown order is through April 24th. 
    
All office hours will now be 8-12 including the district office. Please continue to call ahead. We are asking that individuals arriving at the school offices to pick up items, please wear a face covering in accordance with current recommendations. To make your own mask follow the instructions here >> https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/downloads/DIY-cloth-face-covering-instructions.pdf
    
When picking up food items we would also ask for the courtesy of wearing the face coverings. We want to do our best to protect our staff serving food on the front lines. We’re serving close to 2,000 meals a day and we want to do our best to make sure that our capacity to keep doing that isn’t deterred. 
    
Don’t forget to check out the COVID-19 resource page if you have any needs or concerns, especially related to technology or food. 

Thanks again for all your support!



Sincerely,

Jason Tadlock






Estimadas familias del Distrito Escolar del Área de Elkhorn:



Quisiera enviarles un mensaje breve con algunas noticias. 


    
Gracias para su paciencia y apoyo, significa mucho para el personal del distrito.     
    
No tengo noticias nuevas de una fecha de regreso. El orden de cierre actual está hasta el 24 de abril.     
    
El horario para todas las oficinas de las escuelas, incluso a la oficina del distrito es 8:00 am - 12:00 pm. Favor de llamar antes de ir a la oficina. Pedimos que todas personas llegando a las oficinas para recoger cosas usen una cubierta de tela para la cara según las recomendaciones actuales. Para hacer una mascarilla, sigue las instrucciones aquí >> https://espanol.cdc.gov/enes/coronavirus/2019-ncov/prevent-getting-sick/diy-cloth-face-coverings.html    
    
Cuando recogen comida, también pedimos que usen cubiertas de tela para la cara. Queremos hacer lo mejor posible para proteger nuestro personal que están sirviendo comida a la comunidad. Estamos proporcionando casi 2.000 platos cada día y queremos hacer todo lo que podemos para asegurarnos que nuestra capacidad de seguir con este servicio no esté impedido.    
    
No olviden a ver la información en nuestra página web de COVID-19 si tienen preguntas o dudas.

Sincerely,



Jason Tadlock","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_2","title":"March 26, 2020 - A Message from the District Administrator / Un mensaje del administrador del distrito","content":"Please click on the link below for a video update from the District Administrator.

Please click on the link below to view a video that provides important family updates.

English Version

Spanish Version



Written Presentation","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_4","title":"March 17, 2020 - Family Internet Needs","content":"Hello EASD Families,



One area that the Elkhorn Area School District is trying to help families with is the transition to digital learning by ensuring that all families have access to the internet at home. You are receiving this message because you have been identified as needing a hotspot to support your student’s virtual learning. 



Here are a few options available at this time for families without any internet access:



Spectrum

Spectrum is offering two free months of internet and WiFi services for K-12 students affected by the current school closures. Spectrum is also waiving any installation or prepayment fees to help you get started. You can check to see if you are in a Spectrum serviceable area by clicking on this WiFi coverage map. To sign up, please contact 844-488-8395 to make arrangements for installation. See the attachment to this email for further information. 



TDS

TDS is also offering free internet and WiFi services for K-12 students for 60 days. You may contact TDS at 888-287-8156 for additional information.



EASD Internet Hotspot

Families also have the option of checking out a mobile hotspot from the Elkhorn Area School District. We anticipate receiving hotspots after March 25, 2020. After that date, arrangements can be made to come into the District Office to pick up this device. Since hotspots have a reputation for slow and spotty internet service, we would encourage you to first explore the options listed above if available in your service area. 



Please keep in touch as to which route your family would like to explore. If you have any questions or concerns about these options, feel free to contact me at 262-723-3160 ext. 1415 or email at dricra@elkhorn.k12.wi.us.



Sincerely,



Randy Dricken

Technology Director

Elkhorn Area School District
","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_5","title":"17 de marzo de 2020 - Acceso en casa al internet","content":"Estimadas familias de nuestros estudiantes:



Una de las áreas importantes para nuestros estudiantes durante esta transición al aprendizaje virtual es asegurar que todas familias tienen acceso en casa al internet. El Distrito Escolar del Área de Elkhorn está tratando de aliviar dificultades por proporcionar puntos de acceso (hotspots) cuando sea necesario. Está recibiendo esta comunicación porque ha sido identificado como una familia que necesita acceso al internet para apoyar el aprendizaje virtual de su estudiante(s).



Algunas de las opciones disponibles en este momento para familias sin acceso son: 



Spectrum

Spectrum está proporcionando dos meses gratis de internet y servicios WiFi para los estudiantes K-12 afectados por el cierre de las escuelas. Spectrum está renunciando todos los pagos de instalación y con antelación para facilitar el proceso. Puede confirmar que vive en un área de servicio de Spectrum por ver este mapa de servicio WiFi. Para solicitar este servicio, llame al 844-488-8395 para programar una cita de instalación. Vea el adjunto a este correo electrónico para más información.



TDS

TDS está proporcionando también acceso gratis al internet y los servicios WiFi para estudiantes K-12 por 60 días. Puede comunicarse con TDS al 888-287-8156 para más información.



Hotspot de EASD

Otra opción para familias es pedir prestado uno de los puntos de acceso WiFi del Distrito Escolar del Área de Elkhorn. Esperamos recibir nuevos puntos de acceso después del 25 de marzo. Después de esa fecha, puede comunicarse con la Oficina del Distrito para recoger uno de estos aparatos. Los puntos de acceso son notorios por su servicio inadecuado, y recomendamos que intente de usar una de las otras opciones primero, si son disponibles en su área de servicio.  



Favor de informarnos de la opción que escoge para su familia. Si tiene cualquiera pregunta o duda, comuniquese conmigo al 262-723-3160 ext. 1415 o por correo electrónico dricra@elkhorn.k12.wi.us.





Atentamente,



Randy Dricken

Director de tecnología

Distrito Escolar del Área de Elkhorn","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_6","title":"March 17, 2020 - COVID-19 Update","content":"

Mensaje de COVID-19 >>


","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_8","title":"March 14, 2020 - School Closed","content":"
Dear Families,



BOTTOM LINE UP FRONT:

    
All school and activities are closed starting Monday, March 16.
    
Home-based learning will begin Monday, March 30. 
    
Resources and services will be provided for families. Details below. 


After careful consideration and discussions with the school administrative team and the Board of Education, we have decided that beginning Monday, March 16, 2020, all Elkhorn school activities, including daily face-to-face instruction, before and after school activities and all athletic and co-curricular practices, competitions and weekend events are canceled/postponed through April 5, 2020 (per Governor Ever’s order). This includes all community use of the facilities. We will make every attempt to assure that our students will still have the opportunity to participate in once in a lifetime type events, such as prom and graduation. 



On Monday, March 16, administrative and designated staff will report to school to prepare the plan to support teachers in the transition to home-based learning. Because we have many extra days built into our school calendar, students will not begin to participate in home-based learning until after the scheduled Spring Break. Parents are always welcome to encourage their students to utilize the online tools and offline resources to supplement their student’s learning in the interim but there is no school requirement for the coming week. Beginning Tuesday, March 17, staff members will use the remainder of the week to collaborate with each other and develop best practices for home-based learning, which will begin Monday, March 30. More information regarding these plans will be forthcoming. 



Families can pick up items that were left at school that their child needs through next Wednesday during normal school hours. 



We recognize that closing our schools will impact our families, but we also recognize there are a lot of unknowns regarding this virus. During this mandated closure, the following plans will be in place or are in the works:



If your child has medications at school and you need access to them, you may come to your child’s school Monday between the hours of 8:00 am - 1:00 pm to pick it up. If you need to make alternate arrangements outside of these hours, please contact the school office and we will do our best to accommodate your needs.  



We are preparing a plan for a meal program beginning on Monday, March 30. If you feel that your family may benefit from this service, please complete this short survey. Additional information will be provided when available. 



We realize that this extended closure will put strains on families related to childcare needs. While we cannot guarantee assistance, we have had numerous people reach out and express a desire to help. If you feel that you will need assistance with childcare, please complete this short survey. 



We have had numerous people offer to deliver meals. In order to identify potential volunteers, please complete this short survey. 



Several people have also inquired as to how they can help by providing donations to help support families in need. The Elkhorn Area School District Education Foundation is an avenue through which donations can be applied to helping families in need. If you’d like to contribute, follow this link. 



For our families that do not have internet access at home, and have not already communicated this information to the district, please contact Jodi Essman at 262-723-3160 ext. 1405 or email at essmjo@elkhorn.k12.wi.us. Hot spots for families that do not have internet access will be provided prior to Monday, March 30. 



If you have any specific concerns about your child’s needs, please contact your child’s teacher, building principal or school office. We are here to help. We will continue to provide updates via School Messenger, our school website, and social media pages as we navigate this situation together. Thank you for your patience and understanding. 



Sincerely,



Jason Tadlock

District Administrator","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_9","title":"14 de marzo de 2020 - Escuelas cerradas","content":"
Estimadas familias de nuestro distrito:



LO MÁS IMPORTANTE PRIMERO:

    
Todas las clases y actividades del distrito escolar estarán suspendidas desde el lunes, 16 de marzo.
    
El aprendizaje virtual en casa iniciará el lunes, 30 de marzo.
    
Tendremos recursos y servicios disponibles para familias. Vea los detalles abajo.


Después de mucha consideración y varias discusiones con el personal administrativo y la junta educativa, hemos decidido suspender todas las actividades escolares de Elkhorn, incluso a toda educación en persona, las actividades programadas antes y después de escuela, los entrenamientos de deportes y co-curriculares, torneos y eventos de los fines de semana desde lunes, 16 de marzo hasta el 5 de abril, 2020 (por el orden del Gobernador Evers). Esto incluye todo el uso comunitario de los edificios del distrito. Intentaremos hacer todo lo posible para asegurar que nuestros estudiantes tendrán la oportunidad de participar en estos eventos que pasan una vez en la vida, como el baile de prom y las ceremonias de graduación. 

El lunes, 16 de marzo, el personal administrativo y otro personal designado tendrán que presentarse para preparar a ayudar los maestros con la transición al aprendizaje virtual en casa. Tenemos varios días adicionales incorporados en nuestro calendario escolar, y por eso, los estudiantes no tendrán que participar en el aprendizaje hasta después de las vacaciones de primavera. Como siempre, los padres podrían motivar a sus estudiantes a usar los recursos electrónicos y no electrónicos para complementar el aprendizaje antes del fin de vacaciones, pero no hay ninguna obligación.



El martes, 17 de marzo, todo personal usará el resto de la semana para colaborar y desarrollar los mejores métodos de proporcionar educación digital que empezarán el lunes, 30 de marzo. Más información sobre el aprendizaje digital será disponible tan pronto como posible.



Las familias tendrán la oportunidad de recoger cosas de la escuela que los estudiantes necesitan hasta el miércoles, 18 de marzo durante las horas regulares de la escuela. 



Reconocemos que el cierre de nuestras escuelas tendrá un efecto para nuestra familias, pero también reconocemos que existe mucho desconocido sobre este virus. Durante este cierre ordenado, empezaremos los planes siguientes:

    
Si su estudiante tiene medicamentos en la escuela y los necesita, tendrá la oportunidad de ir a la escuela para recogerlos el lunes entre las horas de 8:00 am - 1:00 pm. Si necesita una hora alternativa, favor de comunicarse con la oficina de la escuela y haremos todo lo que podemos para cumplir con sus necesidades.


    
Estamos preparando un programa de comida para empezar el lunes, 30 de marzo. Si piensa que su familia podría beneficiar de este servicio, llene este formulario corto. Enviaremos más información cuando es disponible.


    
Entendemos que este cierre prolongado podría causar dificultades para nuestras familias con las necesidades de cuidado infantil. Aunque no podemos garantizar asistencia, varias personas han expresado interés en ayudar. Si piensa que su familia necesitará asistencia con cuidado infantil, llene este formulario corto.


 

    
Otras personas han expresado interés en llevar comida a las casas de familias que necesita comida. Si quiere ser voluntario para este programa, llene este formulario corto.


    
Varias personas han preguntado si podrían ayudar a nuestras familias del distrito por donaciones. Una manera es hacer una donación a la Fundación de educación del distrito escolar del área de Elkhorn. Si quiere contribuir, haga clic aquí.


 

    
Para nuestras familias sin internet en casa, si no ha comunicado esta información al distrito, favor de comunicarse con Jodi Essman al 262-723-3160 ext. 1405 o por correo electrónico al essmjo@elkhorn.k12.wi.us. Para las familias sin acceso, vamos a proporcionar puntos de acceso wifi antes del lunes, 30 de marzo.


Si tiene preocupaciones específicas sobre las necesidades de su estudiante, por favor comuníquese a su maestro, director de la escuela o la oficina de la escuela. Estamos a su disposición. Seguiremos a enviar noticias por el mensajero electrónico de la escuela, nuestro sitio web y las páginas web de redes sociales durante esta situación. Muchísimas gracias por su paciencia y compasión. 

Atentamente, 



Jason Tadlock

Administrador del distrito escolar","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_10","title":"March 13, 2020 - A Message from the District Administrator","content":"
Dear Elkhorn Area School District Families,



Bottom Line Up Front:

    
We continue to monitor the COVID-19 situation and recommendations
    
After school events of more than 250 participants are canceled/postponed
    
Community use of more than 250 people is canceled/postponed. 
    
Field trips through the end of March are canceled
    
Additional information regarding school plans will come out tomorrow afternoon


The Elkhorn Area School District continues to closely monitor the current guidelines from the Center for Disease Control (CDC) and the Wisconsin Department of Health Services to remain up to date on recommended precautions. After considerable discussions with our administrative team, we have determined that it is in the best interest of our students and staff to make the following decisions, effective immediately:



Field Trips

All single-day field trips are suspended until further notice.



Athletics

Co-curricular activities are limited to practice within their individual buildings. All competitions are suspended until further notice. 



School Events After Hours 

All school-sponsored events of greater than 250 people are canceled/or suspended.



Community Groups

All community activities will be permitted to run, provided there will be no more than 250 people in attendance. 



Please note that the situation and recommendations are changing rapidly. I will continue to update you regarding school closures and/or potential closures as decisions are made. I expect to send a communication to all families outlining plans for the coming week tomorrow afternoon. I will always do my best to give families as much notice as possible. 



Sincerely,

Jason Tadlock

District Administrator","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_11","title":"March 12, 2020 - A Message from the District Administrator","content":"
Dear Elkhorn Area School District Families,



BOTTOM LINE UP FRONT:

    
We are and have been closely monitoring COVID-19
    
Summer China exchange trip canceled
    
Tonight’s Boys Basketball game has very restrictive attendance guidelines. Live Streamed
    
Follow health guidelines, stay home if ill.
    
Prepare for potential suspension of face to face classes
    
New District Website for future COVID-19 update


EASD staff has closely monitored the situation regarding the 2019 novel coronavirus (COVID-19). We have been working with partner agencies to ensure we are making prudent and timely decisions to protect the health and safety of our students and families.

At this time, we have not received a recommendation from the Health Department at the local or state level to close schools. State Recommendations



Event Cancellations   

At this time the only event that has been canceled is the international trip to China, which was scheduled for this summer.  I do anticipate that we will have more cancellations as we receive more guidance from the state and/or local health departments. We will do our best to not negatively impact students.  However, looking at the national trend, it is likely that events will either have to be canceled or rescheduled.  To avoid the possibility of unnecessary cancellations, decisions regarding event closures will be made when it is determined necessary to assure the protection of our students and families.



WIAA events, including the WIAA boys basketball tournament, will be limited to 88 tickets per team. At this time, the tickets to the boys basketball game in Burlington were dispersed amongst the coaches and players. There are no more tickets available for tonight’s game. Those wishing to receive a refund for previously purchased tickets will be able to do so next week.  Further guidance will be provided when we are ready to issue the refunds. Please save your tickets to receive your refund. If you wish to not claim a refund, we will consider it a donation to support the basketball program. 



Live Streaming Link: We have been granted permission by the WIAA to live stream the game on YouTube beginning at 6:45 pm



Department of Health Services (DHS) Update: Non-essential events with 250+ participants will be canceled/rescheduled until further notice per DHS guidance. We will identify these specific events and how we will either reschedule or modify the event to meet the new state guidelines. Please keep in mind that these guidelines have been rapidly changing in the last 24-48 hours. What we share today may be different tomorrow. 



School Closures

Broadly closing schools is a decision that is not taken lightly and is a last resort as it causes significant community disruption. K-12 schools are considered an essential service by the state and local communities, and thus will remain open as long as possible while balancing the health needs of all.



We recognize that some children have underlying health conditions, such as weakened immune systems, that put them at higher risk. Caregivers of children with underlying health conditions should consult with healthcare providers about whether their children should stay home from school.



Please be informed that in the event that we have a prolonged suspension of face to face classes at school we will schedule digital/home study schooling. We will do our best to support families including providing options for foodservice and assuring that families have access to the internet and learning materials. If your family does not have access to the internet at home, please contact the district office at 262-723-3160 ext. 1405 and speak with my assistant Jodi Essman, so that we can work to assure that we can provide internet access for your family during such a closure. 



Health Guidelines 

The same simple steps that prevent the spread of ordinary flu viruses work against COVID-19 and other illnesses.

    
Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds. Use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer if soap and water are not available.
    
Cough into a tissue or your elbow (not your hand). Then throw the tissue away and wash hands.
    
Avoid touching your eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands.
    
Avoid contact with people who are sick.
    
Stay home when you are sick.
    
Keep students home if their temperature is above 100.4 F (37.8 C) or they report not feeling well, appear weak or ill. This includes respiratory symptoms (cough, sore throat, runny nose) that are associated with a fever.
    
Consult your health care provider if you or your child has special health conditions that put you at increased risk.


Out of an abundance of caution please do not hesitate to keep your child home if they are weak or ill as outlined above. Illness is an excused absence and it does not count against the 10 days guardians have to excuse their children. 



Spring Break Travel

As a reminder, if our families travel to any affected international locations over the upcoming spring break, they will be subject to the quarantine guidelines and any new guidelines that may be implemented by the CDC. We ask that if you travel to any affected countries or regions in the United States that you follow all related guidelines to support the health and safety of our community.



EASD Contacts

The rapid development of COVID-19 has created significant challenges for schools and communities across the country. The 24-hour news and social media cycles have contributed to our collective stress and worry. Things are changing by the day even by the hour. The district will make all attempts to keep you informed and updated. For this purpose, we will continue to use our social media pages, the email system, and we have created a new webpage where all district-level communications will be housed. I want to reiterate that making our schools a healthy and safe environment that provides high-quality education to all students is our primary goal. I want to thank our staff for their continued professionalism and dedication to serving and protecting our students, families, and fellow colleagues.



Sincerely,



Jason Tadlock

District Administrator","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_12","title":"12 de marzo de 2020 - Un mensaje del administrador del distrito","content":"

Estimados familias del Distrito Escolar del Área de Elkhorn:

LO MÁS IMPORTANTE PRIMERO:

 

    

    
Hemos estado y seguimos monitorizando la situación de COVID-19
    
    

    
El viaje del verano a China ha sido cancelado
    
    

    
Las reglas para la asistencia al partido de baloncesto de chicos esta noche son muy restrictivos Ver el partido en vivo aquí
    
    

    
Siga las recomendaciones de salud, quédese en casa si está enfermo.
    
    

    
Prepare para la suspensión potencial de clases en persona
    
    
 
    
Sitio web nuevo para noticias del COVID-19
     


 

El personal de EASD ha monitorizado la situación del coronavirus novedoso de 2019. Estamos colaborando con organizaciones aliadas para asegurar que nuestras decisiones son prudentes y a tiempo para proteger la salud y seguridad de nuestros estudiantes y familias. 

En este momento, no hemos recibido una recomendación sobre la suspensión de clases del Departamento de Salud local o estatal. 

Recomendaciones del estado (en inglés) 

Recomendaciones del estado (en español)



 

Cancelaciones de eventos

En este momento, el único evento que ha sido cancelado es el viaje internacional a China planeado anteriormente para el verano. Es probable que viéramos más cancelaciones después de recibir recomendaciones adicionales de los departamentos de salud locales y estatales. Haremos todo lo posible para no tener un efecto negativo para nuestros estudiantes. Sin embargo, con la tendencia nacional, es probable que tuviéremos que cancelar o reprogramar más eventos. Para evitar cancelaciones innecesarias, haremos las decisiones sobre los eventos en el momento más adecuado para asegurar la seguridad de nuestros estudiantes y familias. 



 

Los eventos WIAA, incluso a los torneos de baloncesto para los chicos y las chicas, tienen un límite de 88 boletos para cada equipo. En este momento, solamente las familias y empleados escolares involucrados con los programas y a la supervisión tienen permiso para asistir los partidos. Este incluye el partido programado para esta noche en Waukesha. Si quiere reembolso para entradas compradas anteriormente tendría la oportunidad de pedirlo la semana que viene. Tendremos más información cuando estamos listos para hacer los reembolsos. Favor de guardar sus entradas (boletos) para recibir el reembolso. Si no quiere un reembolso, lo donamos al programa de baloncesto del distrito escolar. 



 

Enlace para ver el partido en vivo: Tenemos permiso por el WIAA para transmitir el partido en vivo en YouTube a las 6:45 p.m. https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCHd9Y2It1fv1GmbhlR-7zXQ?view_as=subscriber



 

Noticias del Departamento de Salud de Wisconsin (DHS): Todos eventos no esenciales de 250+ participantes han sido cancelados o reprogramados hasta nuevo aviso por el DHS. Identificaremos los eventos específicos y el método que usaremos para reprogramar o modificar cada evento para cumplir con las recomendaciones nuevas del estado. Ten en cuenta que estas recomendaciones han sido cambiando mucho en las últimas 24-48 horas. Lo que compartimos hoy puede ser diferente mañana. 





 

Cierre de escuela

Cerrando varias escuelas es una decisión grave y es el último recurso porque causa una disrupción significativa en la comunidad. Las escuelas K-12 están consideradas un servicio esencial por las comunidades locales y del estado, y por eso mantendrán abiertas hasta el momento último considerando las necesidades de salud de todos.

 

Reconocemos que algunos niños tienen enfermedades o condiciones de salud que se dan un riesgo alto como un sistema inmunodeprimido. Los cuidadores de niños con enfermedades deben consultar sus médicos sobre la decisión de quedarse en casa.

 

Es importante saber que en el evento de una suspensión prolongada de clases en persona los estudiantes tendrán que hacer actividades de aprendizaje electrónicas. Haremos todo lo posible para apoyar a nuestras familias por ofrecer opciones de comida y acceso al internet y los materiales para hacer las tareas en casa. Si su familia no tiene acceso al internet en casa, favor de comunicarse con la oficina del distrito al 262-723-3160 ext. 1405 y habla con mi asistente Jodi Essman para que podamos asegurar el acceso al internet para su familia durante una suspensión prolongada. 

 

Recomendaciones de salud

Las mismas recomendaciones simples para prevenir la propagación del virus de influenza funcionan para el COVID-19 y otras enfermedades. 

    

    
Lávese las manos frecuentemente con jabón y agua por lo menos de 20 segundos. Usa un desinfectante con alcohol si no tiene jabón ni agua. 
    
    

    
Tosa en un pañuelo desechable o el codo (no en la mano). Tire el pañuelo en la basura y lávese las manos. 
    
    

    
Evite de tocar sus ojos, nariz o boca con manos sucias.
    
    

    
Evite contacto con personas enfermas.
    
    

    
Quédese en casa si está enferma. 
    
    

    
Mantenga su estudiante en casa si tienen una temperatura más alta de 100.4 F 

    (37.8 C) o si indica que no se siente bien o si parece débil o enfermo. Esto se trata de síntomas respiratorios (tos, dolor de garganta, secreción nasal) que relacionan con una fiebre.
    
    

    
Consulte su médico si usted o su niño tiene condiciones de salud especiales que se ponen en alto riesgo. 
    


 

Con mucha precaución, no mande su estudiante a la escuela si no está bien o está enfermo como mencionado anteriormente. Estar enfermo es una ausencia justificada y no pesa en contra de los 10 días permitidas para justificar una ausencia de un estudiante.

 



Viajes durante las vacaciones de primavera

Como recordatorio, si nuestras familias viajan durante las vacaciones de primavera a cualquier de los lugares internacionales afectados, tendrán que seguir las regulaciones de cuarentena y cualquiera nueva regulación que puede ser implementado por el Centro para el control y la prevención de enfermedades (CDC). Si viaje a cualquier de los paises afectados o una de las regiones estadounidenses afectados, es importante seguir las recomendaciones adecuadas para apoyar el bienestar y la seguridad de nuestra comunidad.



 

Comunicación con EASD

El desarrollo rápido del COVID-19 ha causado dificultades grandes para escuelas y comunidades en todo el país. Las noticias de 24 horas y social media han contribuido a nuestro estrés y preocupación colectivo. La situación está cambiando por el día y aún por la hora. El distrito intentará todos métodos de comunicación para mantenerse informados. Con este fin, usaremos nuestras páginas de social media, correo electrónico y hemos preparado un sitio web nuevo que tiene todas las comunicaciones del distrito. Quiero enfatizar que nuestro objetivo para el distrito es proveer escuelas seguras y sanas para la educación de buena calidad. Quiero agradecer a nuestros empleados para su profesionalismo continuo y dedicación al servicio y seguridad de nuestros estudiantes, familias y colegas. 



 

Atentamente,

Jason Tadlock

Administrador del distrito","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_13","title":"February 28, 2020 - A Message from the District Nurse","content":"


The following information has been provided to school nurses from the Wisconsin Department of Health Services.



As you’re probably well aware, a new coronavirus called 2019 Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) was detected in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China. This virus has not been previously found in humans. There are thousands of cases in China, and additional cases are being identified in the United States, but only one confirmed case in Wisconsin. 



We know many families are concerned about their students being exposed to the virus, and we first want to assure everyone the risk of getting the virus remains low. 



What are the chances of my student getting this coronavirus?


The risk remains low. 



What about students or staff who have visited China?


Healthy students and staff who visited China and were in the United States before February 2, 2020, can go to school as they normally would. Students and staff returning from China after February 2, 2020, will be contacted by their local health department on an individual basis and will be advised if they can go to school or not. The local health department will make arrangements with individuals if a student or staff member is supposed to be isolated. 



What are the symptoms of the 2019 Novel-Coronavirus?


The symptoms are fever, cough, and difficulty breathing. 



Should my student be wearing a mask to avoid catching coronavirus?


It’s not necessary for anyone to wear a mask during the normal course of their day. The best way to avoid COVID-19, or any virus, is to practice good health hygiene habits. These include:


    
Frequent and thorough handwashing with soap and water
    
    
Use hand sanitizer when soap and water aren’t available
    
    
Cough and sneeze into tissues, or your arm
    
    
Stay home when you’re sick


Flu is very active in Wisconsin, and families should be taking precautions to avoid influenza by following the instructions listed above and by getting flu shots. Please understand this virus is obtained by travel and contact. Ethnicity does not cause someone to get this virus. The COVID-19 investigation changes virtually every day, but there is reliable, factual, and clear information available from your local and state health departments and the U.S. Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). 



Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions or concerns.   



Thank you, 



Mary Trottier, RN


Elkhorn Area School District Nurse


trotma@elkhorn.k12.wi.us


262.723.3160
